contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox vice-regal |realm = The Bahamas |crest = Coat of arms of Bahamas.svg |image = |incumbent = [[Arthur Foulkes|Sir Arthur Foulkes]] |incumbentsince = 14 April 2010 | post-nominals = [[Order of St Michael and St George|GCMG]] |his/her = His |style = The Bahamas |appointed_by = [[Elizabeth II|Queen Elizabeth II]] |first_gg = [[Milo Butler|Sir Milo Butler]] |date = 31 July 1973 |residence = [[Government House, The Bahamas]] |website = [http://www.bahamas.gov.bs/wps/portal/public/gov/government/contacts/directory%20of%20contacts/listed%20alphabetically/directory/arthur%20foulkes/!ut/p/b1/vZTLrqJAFEW_xQ_wcoTiNeSCIEKBvASZGEBBQUAFeX19a3KT7nTS9qRvV41Osuus7DUoIiQCIqyi7pxF7bmuostrDpk9BQoWBMRhhQYGVG-jCxt2RXIy_QzsngH4wxHg3XtTIwmfCFwP2GWNs6UOWh55EhpyGTeptb7jx5kWMlMXfCpHxeUQsNOmU20H7ea-UNEQt2OMejuK1TxVtwnjaqrgDk2v0Aa-Ixdn12DUw3JYcDtXFfuHnK3TcOfzSRv4yfiYsF5ybF87-p3rl7HiXOdnai5TzSk8TCI2l6jl9ev9CJ8x6V_jQS2z43ByBO5y6Gg-Zfmxq_rZ7MvBm5J_cegT4VtNCL4CbzQbq7o8ErtnjP1lj7sFUBcg2M7CAs6mCZcIAO2dfLyqUzHZOWv1Tm5N7hRRiyVA40qO4V2wm5lj0a6hoHHrDabhyoYjJYPDB_gg294naJ52sZ7VfwOapMs_geKC0TwaHIX8bqBCm9zTFOtuBJoEEP87cPFdQMXElvhS6n6-lFKrlcDoFAfofwOZfw5cE-E5Lj_6pPyAD5IHmltwFEOywJE0sc13zBA3uJeW9n6wCzBaPZmCZm_hwgFJNcRIXmaRns_N-V0-kVgtzNIcpofU8MwRlTf-gBFiw9ZkkmvVGxWimdDJzYfY7JUpErMjBLlwSuW6i5mIpm9doIQXvk3jy3TTMp99tj6tUZTt_ZOZFXLI10pgwXjVEiR5KvR1FFvb_eNE-fwSjXepP3eH5lBRmXRM_BrqKj6PmiwFh0j1tCwvwhu3NVZM0dylhc6VTQoXMpK7fY76YzDHqCrYlJezcvP6Sq6l1-mMzRnpz4uF2ewHorr09A!!/dl4/d5/L2dBISEvZ0FBIS9nQSEh/ www.bahamas.gov.bs] }} {{Politics of the Bahamas}} The '''Governor-General of the Commonwealth of the Bahamas''' is the [[viceregal]] representative of the [[Monarchy of the Bahamas|Bahamian Monarch]] (currently [[Queen Elizabeth II]]). As [[Her Majesty the Queen]] cannot reside in all of her [[Commonwealth Realms|realms]], she appoints representatives to carry out her duties as [[Queen of the Bahamas]]. Governors-General serve their term as such [[at Her Majesty's pleasure]], but usually end their term within five years. They are also responsible for appointing the [[Prime Minister of the Bahamas|Prime Minister]] as well as other government Ministers after consultations with the Prime Minister. [[Government House, The Bahamas|Government House]] in [[Nassau, Bahamas|Nassau]] is the official residence of governors-general. The current governor-general is Sir Arthur Alexander Foulkes. ==Governors-General of the Bahamas (1973â€“Present)== {| class="wikitable" ! From ! To !style="width: 40%;"| Name !style="width: 20%;"| Comments |- | 31 July 1973 | 22 January 1979 | [[Milo Butler|Sir Milo Butler]]<br><small>[[GCMG]]</small> | Died in office |- | 22 January 1979 | 25 June 1988 | [[Gerald Cash|Sir Gerald Cash]]<br><small>[[GCMG]], [[GCVO]], [[OBE]]</small> | |- | 26 June 1988 | 1 January 1992 | [[Henry Milton Taylor|Sir Henry Milton Taylor]] | |- | 2 January 1992 | 2 January 1995 | [[Clifford Darling|Sir Clifford Darling]]<br><small>[[GCMG]], [[GCVO]]</small> | |- | 3 January 1995 | 13 November 2001 | [[Orville Turnquest|Sir Orville Turnquest]]<br><small>[[GCMG]], [[QC]]</small> | |- | 13 November 2001 | 30 November 2005 | [[Ivy Dumont|Dame Ivy Dumont]]<br><small>[[DCMG]]</small> | Acting to 1 January 2002 |- | 1 December 2005 | 1 February 2006 | [[Paul Adderley]] | Acting |- | 1 February 2006 | 14 April 2010 | [[Arthur Dion Hanna]] | |- | 14 April 2010 | Present | [[Arthur Foulkes|Sir Arthur Foulkes]]<br><small>[[GCMG]]</small> | |} ==See also== * [[List of colonial heads of the Bahamas]] * [[List of Prime Ministers of the Bahamas]] ==References== {{reflist}} *[http://pdba.georgetown.edu/Constitutions/Bahamas/bah73.html Georgetown University] {{Governors-General of the Commonwealth Realms}} {{Commonwealth realms royal reps}} {{Bahamas topics|state=uncollapsed}} [[Category:Lists of governors-general|Bahamas, List of Governors-General of the]] [[Category:Governors-General of the Bahamas| ]] [[Category:Lists of political office-holders in the Bahamas|Governors-General]]
